arm_group.description: This is a single group study where each enrolled subject will receive active miraDry treatment in each axilla.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate hair reduction in the underarms in patients treated
      with the miraDry System.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is designed to quantify the amount of hair reduction in patients treated with the
      miraDry System in the axilla.  Hair counts will be assessed before and after treatments
      including at follow up visits.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  18 years of age

          -  Visible underarm hair (prefer light colored hair; blonde, red, gray)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Secondary Axillary Hyperhidrosis

          -  Prior surgery and/or Botox Injections in axillae

          -  Pacemaker or requires supplemental oxygen

          -  Pregnant

intervention.description: Application of electromagnetic energy to heat the lower dermis.

facility.name: Laser & Skin Surgery Center of NY

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Study of Axillary Hair Loss in Patients Treated With the miraDry System

other_outcome.description: Patients will provide their evaluation of satisfaction with the hair reduction seen

overall_official.affiliation: Laser and Skin Surgery Center of NY

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients that show a >=30% reduction in underarm hair at the 3 month visit compared to baseline.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients that achieve a >=30% reduction in underarm hair at the 12 month visit compared to baseline

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
